climbs.name: Warchild
climbs.fa: Kevin Capps, equipped by Luke Childers

content.description: This route battles up the left side of the steep, overhanging prow. There is a short and bouldery crux as you climb out the roof that requires heel hooking and slapping at the arÃªte before you can mantel over to the slab above. It's a fun line that probably won't see much action due to the required creek crossing to get to it. A pair of waders helps for colder temps. Luke had a great vision with this route.
content.location: Climb the left side of the steep prow.

content.description: The only route on the left side (top side) of the wave formation.  Crux between the first and second bolt leads to easier fun climbing up the slab to the anchors.
content.location:
This is just left and around the corner from

Warchild

. Belay from the left end of the fixed line.

content.description: LWG has decent rock, with 5-star movement.  Begin in the corner, at the right end of the fixed line.  Head straight up on fun moves for 4 bolts to a good flake under the roof.  Taller people (like 6'3"+) may find the crux easier, because they may be able to go from the undercling to the crimp at the lip.  Shorties will need to utilize the crimpy sidepull up and right of the undercling.  The 5th clip is tense, then easier climbing takes you through another bolt to the anchors.
content.location: Just go catch the wave, brah!!!

content.description: This route is, in my opinion, one of the better moderates on the wall.  Start by clipping the first 2 bolts of LWG, then head right, onto the slab and clip the 2nd bolt on the slab (NOT the first one by the lip).  Finish at the anchors 2nd from the right, below the roof.
content.location: It is the 4th route from the right (see the photo).

content.description: JOJO is the route farthest right on the wall.  Start will overhanging, juggy moves to get established with good feet on the slab.  Continue up and right for 4 more bolts on fun slab climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts, 2-bolts anchor w/rings. (Longer runner for 2nd bolt, or the crack will eat your rope.)
content.location: It is the farthest right route on the wall (see the photo).

content.description:
Update: this has been redpointed as of January, 2014.

Start underneath the overlaps below the slab. The crux is getting between the 1st and 3rd bolt, I would recommend a stick-clip for the second bolt, don't wanna take that whipper onto the first. Finish straight up to the anchors below the roof.

Honestly, I have only tried the moves once, but they are reachy and desperate (not that fun). I may go back to try it eventually, but if you're over there and bored, give it a go!!!
content.location: It is the second bolt line from the right (see pic).

content.description: Starts clipping the first three bolts of the route farthest right, then trend up and left toward the anchors that are second from the right.  The crux is between the second and third bolt, getting established on good feet.  Decent climbing.
content.location: It is the 2nd route from the right (see the photo).
